terms.definition: Cloud-native secure web gateway that provides secure internet and SaaS access for users, regardless of location or device.
Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) service that provides secure access to internal applications without placing users on the network.
Security framework that requires strict identity verification for every user and device attempting to access resources, regardless of location.
Lightweight software deployed in data centers or public clouds that creates an outbound connection to ZPA, enabling secure application access.
Process of decrypting, inspecting, and re-encrypting SSL/TLS traffic to detect threats and enforce policies on encrypted communications.
JavaScript file that determines whether web requests should go through a proxy server based on defined rules.
Tunneling protocol used to encapsulate and route traffic from branch offices to Zscaler cloud.
Cloud-delivered next-generation firewall capability integrated into the Zscaler platform.
